key_responsibilities: handling constituent correspondence
answering phones
monitoring the House floor while in session
providing general administrative assistance

excellent organization and written communications skills

key_responsibilities: greeting visitors
answering phones
monitoring office deliveries and pickups
distributing mail
processing flag and tour requests

other duties as assigned
handle health care for an active Member of the Ways and Means Committee and House Democratic Leadership
other legislative issues

key_responsibilities: manage all aspects of the Member’s daily and long-term schedule in DC
coordinate the Member’s travel
serve as a staff liaison with the Member
assist with administrative office functions as assigned
requirements: ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment
ability to anticipate problems and offer solutions

key_responsibilities: Manage and maintain the Member’s daily and long-term calendar in D.C., as well, coordinate the Member’s district calendar with the Director of Admin
Work with a variety of stakeholders to balance the Member’s time between commitments
Ensure the Member is provided with briefing materials for each event and meeting
Responsible for extensive travel arrangements, expense reports, invoice submittal, and miscellaneous other duties
Driving the Member to and from events (Must have own vehicle)
Manage and maintain administrative/office management duties
Performing other duties as required
requirements: experience as a Senior Executive Assistant
ability to work in a fast-paced environment
excellent writing, verbal, interpersonal and organizational skills
understand the logistics of travel among various time zones
available and able to handle last minute changes to the Member’s schedule
available to work outside of traditional office hours, including evenings and weekends
available to drive the Member to and from events during regular office hours and after hours and when needed, staffing him at offsite events
Senior executive assistant experience and vehicle required

key_responsibilities: lead the Representative’s legislative work and manage a team of Legislative Assistants and Fellows
work with the Chief of Staff, Member, and other senior team members to develop a legislative strategy and priorities
train and supervise the legislative team members
review/approve work from other legislative team members
track legislative accomplishments and statistics
provide vote recommendations
develop and advance legislative proposals from initial idea to final passage
work closely with the District team to ensure that the team’s legislative focus aligns with District priorities and legislative ideas are coming from District issues and casework
manage his/her own portfolio of legislative work
requirements: several years of Hill experience, preferably in the House and ideally in more than one office
facility at managing multiple competing tasks
ability to operate with grace and humor in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: drafting and advancing legislative proposals
preparing the Member for hearings and markups
meeting with stakeholders and constituents
providing vote recommendations
performing additional tasks as assigned
requirements: policy experience in one or more of those issue areas
ability to operate with grace and humor in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
overseeing committee activity
making vote recommendations
writing statements
drafting legislative memos
tracking legislation and meeting with constituents and stakeholders

strong writing and verbal communication skills

office: House Democratic Policy and Communications Committee (DPCC)
key_responsibilities: work with the Executive Director to design and execute strategies that advance the message priorities and values of the House Democratic Caucus
Assist with planning and execution of regular message meetings for Members and staff
Engage in outreach to Democratic offices and provide support with message strategies and communications planning
Assist with daily tasks and long-term planning as needed
requirements: ability to collaborate with others in a tight-knit, fast-paced environment
Familiarity with the House and an understanding of the priorities and values of the House Democratic Caucus
previous experience interacting with elected officials

key_responsibilities: writing press releases
op-eds
franked mail
managing social media and the official website
develop and maintain good relationships with district, state and national media
requirements: ability to work in a fast-pace environment
at least two to three years of relevant experience on Capitol Hill

key_responsibilities: serve as the spokesperson and primary communications advisor to the Member
responsible for developing and executing an aggressive strategic communications plan, including social media, that encompasses local, national, and specialty media outlets

oversee day-to-day press operations including responding to media inquiries, booking the Member for interviews, pitching news opportunities to media outlets, updating and maintaining the Member’s social media accounts, and producing speeches, talking points, floor statements, press releases, op-eds and e-newsletters
managing a Press Secretary
working with the Member, Chief of Staff, Legislative Director, and District Director to develop and coordinate core messaging
requirements: superior writing, editing, and proof-reading skills
willing to work extended hours and oftentimes under time constraints, while maintaining a positive demeanor and sense of humor
fluency in Spanish is a plus

key_responsibilities: cover their work on Homeland Security Committee issues
drafting legislation
writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials
requirements: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment

office: Office of the Law Revision Counsel
key_responsibilities: reading new laws to determine which provisions should appear in the Code and where
updating the Code to reflect new law and amendments to existing law
writing concise editorial notes to explain amendments, effective dates, references within the text to other laws, and a variety of other legislative concepts
preparing statutory citations and tables
identifying errors in grammar and spelling
reviewing drafts of bills to enact titles as positive law
doing extensive research and editorial work to improve the organization of existing provisions in the Code
assisting in the continuing modernization of the Office, including support of online and machine readable versions of the Code
requirements: J.D. degree and attorney license in any U.S. jurisdiction or intention to obtain license within one year
At least one year of professional experience in editing or publishing, preferably in the legal field
Meticulous attention to detail and dedication to accuracy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Absolute proficiency in grammar, spelling, and usage
Ability to analyze and summarize complex legal issues
Ability to identify issues affecting Federal statutes and explain them clearly and concisely within firmly established parameters

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to travel throughout the district
